Did you know that Michigan households that receive Food Assistance Program (also known as SNAP) benefits are now able to buy food online from Amazon.com and Walmart.com using their Bridge Cards?

Availability may vary by location, so be sure to check out each retailer's website for more details:

- Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/snap-ebt/b?ie=UTF8&node=19097785011

- Walmart: https://www.walmart.com/cp/snap-online/1465096#FAQ

It's gardening season in Michigan!

Did you know that SNAP* benefits can be used to purchase seeds and plants to grow food?

In Michigan, SNAP is also known as the Food Assistance Program (FAP) and benefits are received on a Bridge Card.

The Bridge Card and Pandemic EBT (P-EBT) cards can be used to purchase seeds and food-producing plants at any store or farmers market that accepts SNAP benefits and sells these items.

Both cards can also be used to participate in Double Up Food Bucks Michigan. To find out more about the DUFB program, visit https://www.doubleupfoodbucks.org/

To find a farmers market near you that accepts SNAP benefits, visit the Michigan Farmers Market Association website at http://mifma.org/findafarmersmarket/

Sergeant Kelvin Underwood, US Navy assisted by Bryce Toby, raised the United State Flag during the morning announcements at Walton Charter Academy, Pontiac.
Bryce Toby, 5th grader at Walton Charter represents Boy Scout Pack #59. He and his Pack recently learned about US Flag Codes and, in doing so, decided to donate a new flag to Walton. Bryce is joined by Sergeant Underwood of the US Navy and his son, Sincere, who is a 3rd Grader at Walton, as they raise the new flag during the performance of the National Anthem during morning announcements.
